item.title: Howard P. "Buck" McKeon National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2015

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 425.
Select Committee on Intelligence. Hearings held.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 190 (Roll no. 228). (text: CR H4699)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 190 (Roll no. 228).(text: CR H4699)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H4714-4715)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 590, the Chair put the question on adoption of the resolution and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Polis demanded the yeas and nays, and the Chair postponed further proceedings on adoption of the resolution until later in the legislative day.
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H4712)
The House resumed debate on H. Res. 590.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 590.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H4703-4712)
On question of consideration of the resolution Agreed to by voice vote. (consideration: CR H4703)

Mr. McGovern raised a point of order against consideration of H. Res. 590 and the Chair recognized Mr. McGovern and Mr. Nugent for up to 10 minutes each on the point of order. After debate, the Chair will put the question of consideration on the resolution as the statutory means of disposing of the point of order in the following form: "Will the House now consider the resolution?". (consideration: CR H4701)
By direction of the Committee on Rules, Mr. Nugent called up H. Res. 590 for its immediate consideration. (consideration: CR H4699-4706)

Rule provides further consideration of H.R. 4435. No amendment shall be in order except those printed in part A of the report. At the conclusion of consideration for amendment, the Committee shall rise and report the bill to the House with such further amendments as may have been adopted. The previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motion except one motion to recommit with or without instructions. The rule also provides for consideration of H.R. 3361. All points of order against consideration are waived. The bill, as amended by part B of the report
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-460, by Mr. Nugent.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 109.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-460, by Mr. Nugent.

summary.text: Sets forth the rules for consideration of H.R. 4435 (Howard P. "Buck" McKeon National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2015) and H.R. 3361 (USA FREEDOM Act).

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Sets forth the rules for consideration of H.R. 4435 (Howard P. "Buck" McKeon National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2015) and H.R. 3361 (USA FREEDOM Act).

bill.title: Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 4435) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2015 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3361) to reform the authorities of the Federal Government to require the production of certain business records, conduct electronic surveillance, use pen registers and trap and trace devices, and use other forms of information gathering for foreign intelligence, counterterrorism, and criminal purposes, and for other purposes.

item.title: Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 4435) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2015 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3361) to reform the authorities of the Federal Government to require the production of certain business records, conduct electronic surveillance, use pen registers and trap and trace devices, and use other forms of information gathering for foreign intelligence, counterterrorism, and criminal purposes, and for other purposes.

Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 4435) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2015 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3361) to reform the authorities of the Federal Government to require the production of certain business records, conduct electronic surveillance, use pen registers and trap and trace devices, and use other forms of information gathering for foreign intelligence, counterterrorism, and criminal purposes, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
